text.tspan: The side of the surface facing the plasma is
deduced by the user reading the IDS
from the orientation of unit vector e3
* Define a unit vector normal to the surface
* Define a unit vector from the intersection
of the horizontal plane and the surface of interest
(towards increasing phi so e1 = ePhi in simple cases)
* In tokamak's (X, Y, Z) coordinates for generality
* Define polygon contour in (e1, e2) local coordinates

tspan.tspan: Propose a convention for defining a local basis (direct and orthonormal) for orienting a planar

text.tspan: * If (e1, e2) not the best local coordinates for the outline
=> A non-zero tilt angle can be defined with respect to (e1, e2)
A rectangular detector is simple if described in coordinates
in which is is actually a rectangle.
If it is not a rectangle in (e1, e2) coordinates, it can still be
described as a such provided a tilt angle is also stored.
